Many others, including 62 operators from 32 countries, continued to use this route.<ref name="DSB_Final_Report"/>{{rp|224}}<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Abeyratne|first1=Ruwantissa|title=Flight MH 17 and State Responsibility for Ensuring Safety and Security of Air Transport|journal=Journal of Transportation Security|date=1 December 2014|volume=7|issue=4|pages=347–348|doi=10.1007/s12198-014-0148-0|language=en|issn=1938-7741}}</ref> The DSB recommended that states involved in armed conflicts should exercise more caution when evaluating their airspace, and operators should more thoroughly assess the risks when selecting routes over conflict areas.<ref name="BBC13OCT15_1">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34518473 |title=MH17 report: Five key findings from the Dutch Safety Board |newspaper=BBC News |accessdate=13 October 2015|date=2015-10-13 }}</ref>
===Criminal investigation=== The criminal investigation into the downing of MH17 is being led by the [[Openbaar Ministerie|Public Prosecution Service]] of the [[Dutch Ministry of Justice]], and is the largest in Dutch history, involving dozens of prosecutors and 200 investigators.<ref name=":0">{{citation |title=MH17 criminal investigation largest ever in the Netherlands |agency=Xinhua News Agency |date=15 August 2014 |accessdate=27 October 2014 |url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/world/2014-08/15/c_126873336.htm |editor=Mu Xuequan |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140826002055/http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/world/2014-08/15/c_126873336.htm |archive-date=26 August 2014 |dead-url=yes }}</ref> Investigators interviewed witnesses and examined forensic samples, satellite data, intercepted communications, and information on the Web.<ref>{{citation |title=MH17 crash: Investigation focuses on '25 metal shards' |publisher=BBC News |date=12 September 2014 |accessdate=27 October 2014 |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-29180887}}</ref> Participating in the investigation along with the Netherlands, are the four other members of the joint investigation team (JIT),<ref name="TheStarJIT" /> Belgium, Ukraine, Australia, and lastly, Malaysia,<ref>{{cite news |title=Speculation on MH17 is damaging to investigations |newspaper=Free Malaysia Today |agency=[[Bernama]] |date=22 November 2014 |accessdate=22 November 2014 |url=http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/nation/2014/11/22/speculation-on-mh17-is-damaging-to-investigations/}}</ref> which joined in November 2014.<ref name="TheStarJIT">{{cite news |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/News/Nation/2014/12/01/mh17-malaysia-to-be-part-of-investigating-team/ |title=MH17: Malaysia accepted as full member of probe team |newspaper=The Star |location=Petaling Jaya, Malaysia |date=1 December 2014 |accessdate=2 December 2014}}</ref> Early in the investigation, the JIT eliminated accident, internal terrorist attack or air-to-air attack from another aircraft as the cause of the crash.<ref name="SMH JIT">{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/world/malaysia-airlines-flight-mh17-was-shot-down-from-prorussian-rebel-controlled-territory-investigation-finds-20160928-grqter.html|title=Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17 was shot down from pro-Russian rebel controlled territory, investigation finds|first=Nick|last=Miller|date=29 September 2016|work=Sydney Morning Herald}}</ref>
In December 2014, in a letter to the [[United Nations Security Council|Security Council]], the Netherlands [[United Nations|UN]] representative wrote that "The Dutch government is deliberately refraining from any speculation or accusations regarding legal responsibility for the downing of MH17."<ref>{{cite web |title=Letter to President of the UNSC |first=Karel J.G |last=van Oosterom |date=16 December 2014 |accessdate=21 December 2014 |url=http://www.tweedekamer.nl/downloads/document?id=adbae747-b7f0-4713-ad97-1a7e1b75dcd2&title=Brief%20van%20Permanent%20Representative%20of%20the%20Kingdom%20of%20the%20Netherlands.pdf |format=PDF}}</ref> Also in December, the assistant secretary of the [[United States Department of State]]'s European and Eurasian Affairs said America had given all of its information, including classified information to the Dutch investigators and to the [[ICAO]].<ref>{{cite news |title=US Submits Classified Information on MH17 to Investigators: State Dep't |newspaper=[[Sputnik (news agency)|Sputnik]] |date=17 December 2014 |accessdate=21 December 2014 |url=http://sputniknews.com/military/20141217/1015956748.html}}</ref>
On 30 March 2015, the JIT released a Russian-language video calling for witnesses in the [[Donetsk Oblast|Donetsk]] and [[Luhansk Oblast|Luhansk regions]] who might have seen a [[Buk missile system]].<ref name="JITMH17">{{cite web |url=http://jitmh17.com/ |title=Call for witnesses |publisher=Joint Investigation Team |accessdate=30 March 2015}}</ref> The video included some previously undisclosed recordings allegedly of tapped phone conversations between rebel fighters about the Buk. In one recording, of a conversation a few hours after the shoot down, a fighter says that a member of the Buk's accompanying crew had been left behind at a checkpoint. In another recording, dated the day after the shootdown, a rebel allegedly says the Buk system and its crew had been brought from Russia by "the Librarian." The video presents a "scenario" whereby a Buk missile was transported on a [[Volvo]] low loader truck from Sievernyi (Сєверний), a town located within a kilometre of the Russian border (near [[Krasnodon]]), to [[Donetsk]] during the night of 16/17 July.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=olQNpTxSnTo MH17] ''Politie [Police]'' International Joint Investigation Team</ref> In the week following the public appeal, the JIT received more than 300 responses resulting in dozens of "serious witnesses".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/23903198/__Bruikbare_tips_over_daders_MH17__.html|trans-title=Dozens of useful tips about MH17 |title=Tientallen bruikbare tips over MH17 |last=van der Graaf |first=Jolande |language=Dutch |newspaper=De Telegraaf |date=9 April 2015 |accessdate=17 June 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nltimes.nl/2015/04/09/hundreds-respond-to-call-for-mh17-witnesses-tips/ |title=Hundreds respond to call for MH17 witnesses |last=Van Jaarsveldt |first=Janene |date=9 April 2015 |accessdate=17 June 2015 |newspaper=NL Times}}</ref> In 2016 the presence of the [[transloading|transloader]] of matching color with a Buk missile was confirmed on a satellite photo of the area taken just a few hours before the downing of the plane, which was described as "correlating with other evidence" by [[Stratfor]] who found the photo in [[DigitalGlobe]] archive.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.stratfor.com/analysis/examining-evidence-russias-involvement-malaysia-airlines-crash|title=Examining the Evidence of Russia's Involvement in a Malaysia Airlines Crash|website=Stratfor|access-date=13 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.news.com.au/travel/travel-updates/incidents/mh17-the-satellite-images-russia-doesnt-want-us-to-see/news-story/8c03f8e87971d36f70b5402ffbda16ff|title=The image Russia doesn't want the world to see|website=NewsComAu|access-date=16 May 2016}}</ref>
On 9 April 2015 Dutch authorities made available 569 documents concerning the shoot-down. Personal information and official interviews had been redacted. A further 147 documents were not made public.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rtlnieuws.nl/nieuws/binnenland/wat-we-niet-mogen-zien-147-documenten-mh17-blijven-geheim |title=Wat we niet mogen zien: 147 documenten MH17 blijven geheim |work=RTL Nieuws |accessdate=30 July 2015}}</ref>
====Findings of the joint investigation team (JIT)==== On 28 September 2016, the JIT gave a press conference in which it concluded that the aircraft was shot down with a [[Buk missile system|9M38 Buk missile]] fired from a rebel-controlled field near Pervomaisky (Первомайський), a town {{convert|6|km|mi|abbr=on}} south of [[Snizhne]].<ref name="NLTimesJIT">{{cite web|url=http://www.nltimes.nl/2016/09/28/jit-mh17-shot-down-by-a-9m38-buk-missile-from-russian-origin/|title=JIT: MH17 shot down with missile fired from pro-Russian rebel controlled field}}</ref> It also found the Buk missile system used had been transported from Russia into Ukraine on the day of the crash, and then back into Russia after the crash, with one missile less than it arrived with.<ref name="SMH JIT"/><ref name="BBC News 28 September 2016">{{cite web |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-37495067 |title= MH17 missile 'came from Russia', Dutch-led investigators say |author= <!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= 28 September 2016|website= [[BBC News Online]] |publisher= [[BBC]] | accessdate= 2 October 2016 }}</ref> The JIT said they had identified 100 people, witnesses as well as suspects, who were involved in the movement of the Buk launcher, though they had not yet identified a clear chain of command to assess culpability, which was a matter for ongoing investigation. The Dutch chief prosecutor said "the evidence must stand before a court" which would render final judgement.<ref name="SMH JIT"/> During the investigation, the JIT recorded and assessed five billion internet pages, interviewed 200 witnesses, collected half a million photos and videos, and analysed 150,000 intercepted phone calls.<ref name="NLTimesJIT"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.om.nl/onderwerpen/mh17-crash/@96066/presentation/ |title=Presentation preliminary results criminal investigation MH17 28-09-2016}}</ref> According to JIT head prosecutor Fred Westerbeke the criminal investigation is based on "immense body of evidence," including testimonies of live witnesses who saw the "Buk" launcher, primary radar data, original photos and videos.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.novayagazeta.ru/articles/2017/10/16/74192-the-purpose-is-to-bring-this-matter-to-court|title="The purpose is to bring MH17 matter to court"|work=Новая газета – Novayagazeta.ru|access-date=16 October 2017|language=ru-RU}}</ref>
[[File:Engineering Technologies 2010 Part3 0031 copy.jpg|thumb|A Buk SAM of the type used by the [[53rd Anti-Aircraft Missile Brigade]]]] On 24 May 2018, after extensive comparative research, the JIT concluded that the Buk that shot down the flight came from the Russian [[53rd Anti-Aircraft Missile Brigade]] in [[Kursk]].<ref name="jit">{{cite web | url =https://www.om.nl/onderwerpen/mh17-crash/@103196/update-criminal-0/ |title=Update in criminal investigation MH17 disaster|publisher=[[Openbaar Ministerie]]| date=24 May 2018| accessdate =24 May 2018}}</ref> The head of the National Investigation Service of the Dutch police asked the eyewitnesses and insiders to share information about the identities of the Buk crew members, the instruction the crew members followed and persons responsible for the operational deployment of the involved Buk on 17 July 2014.<ref name="jit"/> According to Dutch [[Openbaar Ministerie|Public Prosecution Service]], by 24 May 2018 "the authorities of the Russian Federation have ... not reported to the JIT that a Buk of the 53rd Brigade was deployed in Eastern Ukraine and that this Buk downed flight MH17."<ref name="jit"/> In response, Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]] stated that Russia will analyze the JIT conclusion, but will acknowledge it only if it becomes a party in the investigation.<ref name="kommersant">{{cite web | url = https://www.kommersant.ru/doc/3638260|title=Владимир Путин пообещал изучить выводы следствия о катастрофе Boeing MH17|work=[[Kommersant]]| language=Russian|date=24 May 2018| accessdate =24 May 2018}}</ref> The [[Ministry of Defence (Russia)|Russian Ministry of Defence]] in turn stated that no Russian Buk crossed the border with Ukraine.<ref name="kommersant"/>
On 25 May 2018 the governments of the Netherlands and Australia issued a joint statement in which they laid responsibility on Russia "for its part" in the crash.<ref name=":1" /> The Netherlands and Australian foreign ministers stated that they would hold Russia legally responsible for shooting the airliner down. Netherlands Foreign Minister [[Stef Blok]] stated that "the government is now taking the next step by formally holding Russia accountable," and, "The Netherlands and Australia today asked Russia to enter into talks aimed at finding a solution that would do justice to the tremendous suffering and damage caused by the downing of MH17. A possible next step is to present the case to an international court or organization for their judgment."<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/netherlands-australia-flight17-statement-russia-1.4677473|title = Netherlands, Australia holding Russia 'accountable' for downing of MH17|access-date = 25 May 2018|author=[[The Associated Press]] |work = [[CBC News]]|date = 25 May 2018}}</ref>
Several other countries and international organisations expressed their support for the JIT's conclusions and the joint statement by the Netherlands and Australia.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://nos.nl/artikel/2233506-internationale-reacties-op-mh17-rusland-moet-verantwoordelijkheid-nemen.html |title=Internationale reacties op MH17: Rusland moet verantwoordelijkheid nemen |access-date=29 May 2018 |work=[[Nederlandse Omroep Stichting|NOS]] |date=25 May 2018 |language=Dutch}}</ref> UK Foreign Secretary [[Boris Johnson]] said the United Kingdom "fully supports Australia and the Netherlands," calling on Russia to cooperate.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.gov.uk/government/news/foreign-secretary-statement-on-the-mh17-investigation |title=Foreign Secretary statement on the MH17 investigation |access-date=29 May 2018 |work=[[Foreign & Commonwealth Office]] |date=25 May 2018}}</ref> High Representative [[Federica Mogherini]] of the EU stated that the European Union "calls on the Russian Federation to accept its responsibility" and to cooperate as well.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.consilium.europa.eu/en/press/press-releases/2018/05/25/declaration-by-the-high-representative-on-behalf-of-the-eu-on-the-findings-of-the-joint-investigation-team-on-the-downing-of-flight-mh17/ |title=Declaration by the High Representative on behalf of the EU on the findings of the Joint Investigation Team on the downing of flight MH17 |access-date=29 May 2018 |work=[[European Council]] |date=25 May 2018}}</ref> The German government called on Russia to "fully explain the tragedy."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bundesregierung.de/Content/DE/Artikel/2018/05/2018-05-25-ukraine-mh17-gutachten.html |title="Die Schuldigen ermitteln" |access-date=29 May 2018 |work=[[Bundesregierung]] |date=25 May 2018 |language=German}}</ref> The US Department of State issued a statement saying that the United States "strongly support the decisions by the Netherlands and Australia," requesting Russia to acknowledge its involvement and to "cease its callous disinformation campaign."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2018/05/282502.htm |title=Calling Russia To Account for Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-17 |access-date=29 May 2018 |work=[[United States Department of State]] |date=25 May 2018}}</ref> NATO Secretary General [[Jens Stoltenberg]] called on Russia to "accept responsibility and fully cooperate ... in line with [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 2166]]."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nato.int/cps/en/natohq/news_154585.htm |title=Statement by the NATO Secretary General on MH17 investigation |access-date=29 May 2018 |work=[[NATO]] |date=25 May 2018}}</ref> In response to the JIT's conclusions, Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]] reiterated that the Russians are "not involved in it."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://en.kremlin.ru/events/president/news/57556 |title=St Petersburg International Economic Forum plenary session |access-date=29 May 2018 |work=[[Kremlin]] |date=25 May 2018}}</ref>
====Proposed international tribunal==== In June 2015, the Netherlands, supported by the other JIT members, sought to create an international tribunal to prosecute those suspected of downing the Malaysian airliner, which would take up the case after the closing of the criminal investigation. The Dutch hoped that an international tribunal would induce Russian cooperation, which was considered critical.<ref>{{cite news |title=Exclusive: International tribunal looks like best chance for MH17 justice – Dutch sources |agency=Reuters |date=23 June 2015 |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/06/23/us-ukraine-crisis-mh-idUSKBN0P326E20150623 |first=Anthony |last=Deutsch |accessdate=25 June 2015}}</ref> In late June 2015, the Russian government rejected a request by the five countries on the investigative committee to form a UN tribunal which would try those responsible for the shooting down of the aircraft, calling it "not timely and counterproductive."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/jun/26/russia-rejects-calls-for-un-tribunal-malaysia-airlines-flight-mh17 |title=Russia rejects calls for UN tribunal to prosecute MH17 suspects |work=The Guardian |agency=Agence France-Presse |accessdate=28 June 2015 |date=26 June 2015}}</ref> On 8 July 2015, Malaysia, a member of the [[UN Security Council]], distributed a draft resolution to establish such a tribunal. This resolution was jointly proposed by the five JIT member countries. Russian UN Ambassador [[Vitaly Churkin]] responded, "I don't see any future for this resolution. Unfortunately, it seems that this is an attempt to organize a grandiose, political show, which only damages efforts to find the guilty parties."<ref name=churkin>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/malaysia-airlines-mh17-russia-rebukes-push-for-un-tribunal-1.3146029 |title=Malaysia Airlines MH17: Russia rebukes push for UN tribunal |date=10 July 2015 |publisher=[[CBC News]] |accessdate=10 July 2015}}</ref> Russia later circulated a rival resolution which criticised the international investigation's lack of "due transparency" and demanded those responsible be brought to justice, but which did not call for a tribunal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Russia's UN Draft on MH17 Crash Doesn't Call for Tribunal |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/wireStory/russias-draft-mh17-crash-call-tribunal-32575088 |agency=Associated Press |date=20 July 2015 |author=Edith M. Lederer |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150722201823/http://abcnews.go.com/US/wireStory/russias-draft-mh17-crash-call-tribunal-32575088 |archivedate=22 July 2015 |df= }}</ref> In a vote, Malaysia's resolution gained majority support of the UNSC, but was [[United Nations Security Council veto power|vetoed]] by Russia.<ref name=veto>{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/07/29/us-ukraine-crisis-mh17-un-idUSKCN0Q32GS20150729 |title=Russia vetoes bid to set up tribunal for downed Flight MH17 |author=Michelle Nichols |agency=Reuters |date=29 July 2015}}</ref>
====Criminal prosecution==== In a statement by the Dutch Minister of Foreign Affairs of 5 July 2017, it was announced that the JIT countries will prosecute any suspects identified in the downing of flight MH17 in the Netherlands and under Dutch law.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.government.nl/latest/news/2017/07/05/statement-by-the-minister-of-foreign-affairs-on-mh17-5-july-2017 |title=Statement by the minister of Foreign Affairs on MH17, 5 July 2017 |work=Government of the Kingdom of the Netherlands |agency=Ministry of Foreign Affairs |date= 7 July 2017}}</ref> A future treaty between the Netherlands and Ukraine will make it possible for the Netherlands to prosecute in the cases of all 298 victims, regardless of their nationality. This treaty was signed on 7 July 2017.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.rijksoverheid.nl/ministeries/ministerie-van-veiligheid-en-justitie/nieuws/2017/07/05/jit-landen-kiezen-nederland-voor-vervolging-neerhalen-mh17 |title=JIT-landen kiezen Nederland voor vervolging neerhalen MH17 |language=Dutch |work=Government of the Kingdom of the Netherlands |agency=Ministry of Security and Justice |date= 7 July 2017}}</ref> On 21 March 2018, the Dutch government sent legislation to the parliament, allowing the suspects involved to be prosecuted in the Netherlands under [[Law of the Netherlands|Dutch law]]. {{As of|2018|May}}, no charges have been filed.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-03-21/legislation-clears-way-for-mh17-trials-in-the-netherlands|title=Legislation Clears Way for MH17 Trials in the Netherlands|date=21 March 2018|work=Bloomberg.com|access-date=22 March 2018|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.unian.info/world/10052111-dutch-court-may-be-allowed-to-prosecute-those-involved-in-mh17-crash-by-video-link.html|title=Dutch court may be allowed to prosecute those involved in MH17 crash by video link|access-date=13 April 2018|language=en}}</ref>
==British ISC report== On 20 December 2017, the [[Intelligence and Security Committee of Parliament|Intelligence and Security Committee]] of the UK Parliament published its annual report. It contains a short section entitled "Russian objectives and activity against UK and allied interests" which quotes MI6 as stating: "Russia conducts information warfare on a massive scale... An early example of this was a hugely intensive, multichannel propaganda effort to persuade the world that Russia bore no responsibility for the shooting down of [Malaysian Airlines flight] MH-17 (an outright falsehood: we know beyond any reasonable doubt that the Russian military supplied and subsequently recovered the missile launcher)".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Toler|first1=Aric|title=British Intelligence Report Confirms Russian Military Origin of MH17 Murder Weapon|url=https://www.bellingcat.com/news/uk-and-europe/2017/12/20/british-intelligence-report-confirms-russian-military-origin-mh17-murder-weapon/|website=Bellingcat|accessdate=21 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=ISCP Annual Report 2016-2017|url=https://b1cba9b3-a-5e6631fd-s-sites.googlegroups.com/a/independent.gov.uk/isc/files/2016-2017_ISC_AR.pdf?attachauth=ANoY7cqS8WVJqzXucCjkPcD1PkT4M4RJspBV9tHBYEJAZLobTFw2rG67hpLh55zoZsZ9_9Xrmtqiq4CzbwmhAUpzCTh3AW-lBjOdmWFYJds1-EYzBgJGRmPWubVpg_Yl0SrMUrYTcKGn-8HtPvf5AARiu60msxtT2SpjJfdv78EEeqkINZBUythVem1KHFtKbbziZLQNdiiOymaCinv1pUa1FIpSVaHOkjNwmyfFteiMvnTRX00Qz_0%3D&attredirects=0}}</ref>
==Civil cases== In July 2015 a writ was filed in an American court by families of 18 victims accusing the separatist leader Igor Girkin of "orchestrating the shootdown" and the Russian government of being complicit in the act. The writ was brought under the [[Torture Victim Protection Act of 1991]].<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/11742865/MH-17-Russian-separatist-leader-sued-for-900-million-by-crash-victims.html]. MH-17-Russian-separatist-leader-sued-for-900-million-by-crash-victims</ref> In May 2016 families of 33 victims of the crash filed a claim against Russia and president Vladimir Putin in the [[European Court of Human Rights]], arguing Russian actions violated the passengers' right to life.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36350520|title=MH17 crash: Victims' families sue Putin and Russia|website=BBC News|access-date=22 May 2016}}</ref><ref>Blakkarly, Jarni (22 May 2016). [http://in.reuters.com/article/australia-mh-idINL3N18J00O UPDATE 1-Australian firm names Russia, Putin in MH17 compensation claim -report.] ''Reuters.'' Retrieved: 22 May 2016.</ref> A group of 270 relatives of Dutch victims joined the claim in May 2018 after the JIT concluded that Russia was involved.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://nos.nl/artikel/2233480-nabestaanden-mh17-naar-europees-hof-voor-schadeclaim-tegen-rusland.html|title=Nabestaanden MH17 naar Europees Hof voor schadeclaim tegen Rusland|work=NOS|access-date=30 May 2018|date=25 May 2018|language=Dutch}}</ref> In July 2016, Malaysia Airlines was sued in Malaysia by 15 passengers' families in two separate writs, each brought under the [[Montreal Convention]], arguing that the airline should not have chosen that route.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/malaysia/article/mh17-kin-sue-malaysia-airlines-seek-damages-ahead-of-lawsuit-deadline|title=MH17 kin sue Malaysia Airlines, seek damages ahead of lawsuit deadline|author=Yap Tzu Ging|date=15 July 2016|newspaper=Malay Mail Online}}</ref> A month earlier, a separate lawsuit was brought by the families of 6 crew members who alleged negligence and breach of contract by the airline.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/missing-malaysia-plane-crew-lawsuit-1.3612177|title=Malaysia Airlines sued by relatives of MH17 crew shot down over Ukraine|agency=The Associated Press|date=2 June 2016}}</ref>
==Reactions== {{main|International reactions to the Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 shootdown}} <!--PLEASE DON'T ADD ANY PICTURES OF WORLD LEADERS IN THIS SECTION A/P TALK PAGE DISCUSSION AND ARCHIVES--> <!-- Please don't add "condolences" per WP:MEMORIAL. Please don't add tiny flags or bullet points; consensus is that it is better as prose. Thanks. -->
===Countries=== Ukrainian President [[Petro Poroshenko]] called the crash the result of an act of terrorism, and also called for an international investigation into the crash.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/10974784/Malaysia-Airlines-crash-President-Poroshenko-calls-shooting-down-of-Malaysian-plane-an-act-of-terrorism.html |work=The Daily Telegraph |title=Malaysia Airlines crash: President Poroshenko calls shooting down of Malaysian plane an 'act of terrorism' |date=17 July 2014 |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref>
Malaysian Deputy Foreign Minister [[Hamzah Zainuddin]] said that the foreign ministry would be working with the Russian and Ukrainian governments with regard to the incident.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.cri.cn/12394/2014/07/18/2941s836537.htm |title=Malaysia to Work with Russia, Ukrainian Governments on MH17 |publisher=English.cri.cn |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> Prime Minister Najib Razak said that Malaysia was unable yet to verify the cause of the crash and demanded that the perpetrators be punished.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.voanews.com/content/malaysian-pm-demands-swift-justice-if-plane-was-shot-down/1960042.html |title=Malaysian PM Demands Swift Justice if Plane Was Shot Down |agency=Reuters |publisher=[[Voice of America]] |date=17 July 2014 |accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> The [[Government of Malaysia|Malaysian government]] flew the [[Flag of Malaysia|national flag]] at [[half-mast]] from 18 July until 21 July.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.stasiareport.com/news/asia/south-east-asia/story/malaysia-airlines-mh17-crash-flags-fly-half-mast-over-next-three-day |title=Malaysia Airlines MH17 crash: Flags to fly at half-mast over next three days, says Najib |author=Yong Yen Nie |publisher=Straits Times Asia Report |date=18 July 2014 |accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
[[File:Nederlandse vlag halfstok voor stadhuis Hoorn.jpg|thumb|upright|Flag at half mast in front of [[Hoorn]] city hall during the national day of mourning on 23 July]]
Dutch Prime Minister [[Mark Rutte]] and King [[Willem-Alexander]] voiced their shock at the crash,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/22867019/__Verklaring_Rutte_over_MH17__.html |title=Verklaring premier Rutte over crash MH17 | Binnenland |language=Dutch |work=De Telegraaf |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://dc.the-netherlands.org/news/2014/07/statement-king-willem-alexander.html |title=Statement of His Majesty King Willem-Alexander on Malaysian Flight MH17 |work=Kingdom of the Netherlands |publisher=The Netherlands Embassy in Washington, D.C., United States |date=17 July 2014 |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> and Minister of Foreign Affairs [[Frans Timmermans]] joined the Dutch investigation team sent to Ukraine.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.volkskrant.nl/vk/nl/2668/Buitenland/article/detail/3691806/2014/07/18/Timmermans-mee-met-onderzoekers-naar-Oekraine.dhtml |title=Timmermans mee met onderzoekers naar Oekraïne |language=Dutch |work=ANP |date=18 July 2014 |accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> Dutch government buildings flew the flag at half-mast on 18 July.<ref name="nieuws.nl">{{cite web |url=http://nieuws.nl/algemeen/20140717/vlaggen-overheidsgebouwen-halfstok-na-vliegramp/ |title=Vlaggen overheidsgebouwen halfstok na vliegramp |language=Dutch |author=Novum |publisher=Nieuws.nl |date=17 July 2014 |accessdate=17 July 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140726214011/http://www.nieuws.nl/algemeen/20140717/Vlaggen-overheidsgebouwen-halfstok-na-vliegramp |archive-date=26 July 2014 |dead-url=yes }}</ref> Music was cancelled and festivities were toned down on the last day of the [[Nijmegen Marches]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nieuws.nl/algemeen/20140718/vierdaagse-nijmegen-muziek-geschrapt-wegens-vliegramp/ |title=Vierdaagse Nijmegen: muziek geschrapt wegens vliegramp |language=Dutch |author=Novum |publisher=nieuws.nl |date=18 July 2014 |accessdate=18 July 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402114956/http://nieuws.nl/algemeen/20140718/vierdaagse-nijmegen-muziek-geschrapt-wegens-vliegramp/ |archive-date=2 April 2015 |dead-url=yes}}</ref> On 21 July the Netherlands opened a war crimes investigation on the downing of the aircraft and a Netherlands public prosecutor went to Ukraine as part of this investigation. Rutte threatened tough action against Russia if it did not help in the investigation.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://news.yahoo.com/netherlands-opens-investigation-airliner-shoot-down-131650202.html |title=Netherlands opens war crimes investigation into airliner downing |author1=Thomas Escritt |author2=Angus MacSwan |date=21 July 2014 |website=[[Yahoo! News]]}}</ref> An increase in negative emotions and somatic complaints was observed in the Dutch population during the first four days after the MH17 crash.<ref>{{Cite journal |author= Jeronimus et al. | year = 2018 | title = Acute stress responses after indirect exposure to the MH17 airplane crash| url = https://doi.org/10.1111/bjop.12358| journal = British Journal of Psychology| volume = 0 | issue = 0| page = 1-24 | doi=10.1111/bjop.12358}}</ref>
Australian Prime Minister [[Tony Abbott]] said in an address to parliament that the aircraft was downed by a missile which seemed to have been launched by Russian-backed rebels.<ref name=DT>{{cite news |last1=Maiden |first1=Samantha |title=MH17: Russia says Tony Abbott 'operating only on speculation' in his tough stance over separatist involvement in plane tragedy |url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/nsw/mh17-russia-says-tony-abbott-operating-only-on-speculation-in-his-tough-stance-over-separatist-involvement-in-plane-tragedy/story-fni0cx12-1226994356506 |accessdate=19 July 2014 |work=The Daily Telegraph |location=Australia |date=19 July 2014}}</ref> [[Julie Bishop]], the Australian Minister for Foreign Affairs, said in an interview on an Australian television programme that it was "extraordinary" that her Russian counterparts had refused to speak to her over the shootdown after the Russian ambassador was summoned to meet her.<ref name=DT/> The Russian government was critical of Abbott's response; Abbott was one of the first world leaders to publicly connect the shootdown to Russia.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-07-19/russia-says-abbott-comments-mh17-downing-unacceptable/5608852?pfm=ms |title=Malaysia Airlines MH17: Russia says Tony Abbott's comments blaming separatists are 'unacceptable', Julie Bishop criticises Moscow for lack of talks – ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation) |publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corporation |accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref> Abbott later criticised the recovery efforts as "shambolic", and "more like a garden clean-up than a forensic investigation"; Bishop publicly warned separatist forces against treating the victims' bodies as hostages.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-07-21/government-considers-declaring-mh17-disaster-a-terrorist-act/5610908?pfm=ms |title=MH17: Prime Minister Tony Abbott hits out at 'shambolic' recovery effort; Government considers listing outrage as terrorist act; rebels move bodies to refrigerated train – ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation) |publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corporation |date=17 July 2014 |accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref> Abbott also said in an interview on 13 October 2014, in anticipation of Russia's President [[Vladimir Putin]]'s attendance at the [[2014 G20 Brisbane summit|2014 G20 summit]], scheduled for mid-November 2014 in [[Brisbane]], Australia: "Australians were murdered. They were murdered by Russian-backed rebels using Russian-supplied equipment. We are very unhappy about this."<ref>{{cite news |author1=Sabra Lane |title=Tony Abbott promises to 'shirtfront' Putin at G20 Summit |url=http://www.abc.net.au/7.30/content/2014/s4106143.htm |accessdate=14 October 2014 |work=7:30 |date=13 October 2014}}</ref>
Russian President Putin said that Ukraine bore responsibility for the incident which happened in its territory, which he said would not have happened if hostilities had not resumed in the south-east of Ukraine.<ref name="telegraph"/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://ria.ru/society/20140718/1016472533.html|script-title=ru:Путин: за авиакатастрофу несет ответственность Украина |trans-title=Putin: Ukraine responsible for the crash |language=Russian |date=18 July 2014 |agency=RIA Novosti |quote="Безусловно, государство, над территорией которого это произошло, несет ответственность за эту страшную трагедию", – сказал глава РФ |accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref><ref name="biden">{{cite news |url=http://www.msnbc.com/msnbc/biden-malaysia-airlines-crash |publisher=MSNBC |title=Joe Biden: Malaysia Airlines flight 'apparently' shot down |date=17 July 2014 |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> He also said that it was important to refrain from reaching hasty conclusions and politicised statements before the end of the investigation. He said that Russia would help an international inquiry led by the ICAO.<ref name=RT-live>{{cite news |title=Malaysia Airlines MH17 plane crash in Ukraine LIVE UPDATES |url=http://rt.com/news/173628-malaysian-plane-crash-ukraine/ |accessdate=21 July 2014 |publisher=RT |date=17 July 2014}}</ref> At the end of July a [[Duma]] deputy [[Ilya Ponomarev]] said in an interview for ''[[Die Welt]]'' that the separatists had shot down the plane by mistake and that Putin now realised he had supplied the weapon to the "wrong people".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.welt.de/politik/ausland/article130579514/Putin-realisiert-dass-er-die-Falschen-bewaffnete.html |title=Putin realisiert, dass er die Falschen bewaffnete |work=Die Welt |date=26 July 2014 |accessdate=1 August 2014 |author=Silke Mülherr und Inga Pylypchuk}}</ref> The [[Danish Institute for International Studies]] has pointed out to the similarities of Russian reaction to the downing of [[Korean Air Lines Flight 007|Korean Airlines flight KAL-007]] in 1983 where the USSR initially denied any involvement.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://pure.diis.dk/ws/files/950041/DIIS_RP_2017_6_web.pdf|title=Russian Hybrid Warfare|last=|first=|date=|website=Danish Institute for International Studies|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170824221700/http://pure.diis.dk/ws/files/950041/DIIS_RP_2017_6_web.pdf|archive-date=24 August 2017|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref>
United States President [[Barack Obama]] said the United States would help determine the cause.<ref name="telegraph"/> In a press statement, White House spokesman [[Josh Earnest]] called for an immediate ceasefire in Ukraine to allow for a full investigation.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Mason |first1=Jeff |last2=Holland |first2=Steve |title=White House urges Ukraine ceasefire for plane probe, Obama talks to Putin |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/07/18/us-ukraine-crisis-obama-idUSKBN0FN0D420140718 |accessdate=18 July 2014 |agency=Reuters |date=18 July 2014}}</ref> Vice-President [[Joe Biden]] said the plane appeared to have been deliberately shot down, and offered American assistance for the investigation into the crash.<ref name="biden"/> [[United States Ambassador to the United Nations|American Ambassador to the United Nations]] [[Samantha Power]] called on Russia to end the war.<ref name=nytimes1>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/19/world/europe/malaysia-airlines-plane-ukraine.html |title=Obama Points to Pro-Russia Separatists in Downing of Malaysia Airlines Plane |first=Michael D. |last=Shear |first2=Somini |last2=Sengupta |first3=Sabrina |last3=Tavernise |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=18 July 2014 |accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> The British government requested an emergency meeting of the [[United Nations Security Council]] and called an emergency [[Cabinet Office Briefing Room|Cobra]] meeting after the incident.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Leonard |first1=Peter |title=Ukraine: 295 on Malaysia plane shot down over east |url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/official-malaysian-plane-shot-down-over-ukraine |work=Associated Press |publisher=The Big Story |accessdate=17 July 2014 |ref=APBigStory |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140717190514/http://bigstory.ap.org/article/official-malaysian-plane-shot-down-over-ukraine |archivedate=17 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/10975874/MH17-plane-crash-David-Cameron-urges-those-responsible-for-downing-jet-to-be-held-to-account.html |title=MH17 plane crash: David Cameron urges those responsible for downing jet to be 'held to account' |newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=18 July 2014 |accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> Chairman of the US [[Joint Chiefs of Staff]] [[Martin E. Dempsey]] said that instead of backing away from supporting the rebels in the wake of the airliner shootdown, Putin had "taken a decision to escalate."<ref>David M. Herszenhorn (25 July 2014), [https://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/26/world/europe/russian-artillery-fires-into-ukraine-kiev-says.html ''Russia Steps Up Help for Rebels in Ukraine War,''] ''[[The New York Times]]''.</ref>
===Organisations=== On 17 July the European Union's representatives [[José Manuel Barroso]] and [[Herman Van Rompuy]] released a joint statement calling for an immediate and thorough investigation.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://europa.eu/rapid/press-release_STATEMENT-14-231_en.htm?locale=en |title=EUROPA PRESS RELEASES – Press release – Joint statement by the President of the European Commission, José Manuel Barroso, and the President of the European Council, Herman Van Rompuy, on the crash of the Malaysian airliner in Ukraine |publisher=Europa (web portal) |date=17 July 2014 |accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref> The EU officials also said that Ukraine has first claim on the plane's black boxes.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/malaysian-plane-mh17-crash-investigators-face-struggle/1/373127.html |title=Malaysian plane MH17 crash investigators face struggle : Asia, News |work=India Today |accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
The [[International Civil Aviation Organization]] announced, on 18 July, that it was sending its team of experts to assist the [[National Bureau of Air Accidents Investigation of Ukraine]] (NBAAI), under Article 26 of the [[Convention on International Civil Aviation]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.icao.int/Newsroom/Pages/Ukraine-requests-ICAO-assistance-in-MH17-accident-investigation.aspx |title=Ukraine Requests ICAO Assistance in MH17 Accident Investigation |publisher=ICAO |date=18 July 2014 |accessdate=20 July 2014}}</ref> The [[United Nations Security Council]] adopted [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 2166|Resolution 2166]] on 21 July, regarding an official crime investigation into the incident. On 24 July 2014 the ICAO issued a State Letter reminding signatory states of their responsibilities with respect to the safety and security of civil aircraft operating in airspace affected by conflict.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.icao.int/Newsroom/Pages/ICAO-clarifies-State-responsibilities-arising-from-conflict-zones.aspx |title=ICAO Clarifies State Responsibilities Arising from Conflict Zones |publisher=ICAO |date=24 July 2014 |accessdate=10 October 2014}}</ref>
[[File:Amsterdam Airport- Flight MH17 Memorial (14675744526)~2.jpg|thumb|A makeshift memorial at [[Schiphol Airport]] for the victims of Flight MH17]] After the crash, memorial services were held in Australia<ref name="itv-memorial">{{cite news |url=http://www.itv.com/news/update/2014-07-20/memorial-service-held-for-mh17-victims-in-australia/ |title=Australia mourns MH17 victims at memorial service |work=ITV News |date=20 July 2014 |accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref> and in the Netherlands, which declared 23 July, the day when the first victims arrived in the country, a [[national day of mourning]], the first since 1962.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nu.nl/binnenland/3834822/woensdag-23-juli-dag-van-nationale-rouw.html |title=Woensdag 23 juli dag van nationale rouw | nu.nl/binnenland | Het laatste nieuws het eerst op |publisher=Nu.nl |accessdate=22 July 2014}}</ref><ref name="ibt-mourning">{{cite news |url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/netherlands-declares-national-day-mourning-mh17-victims-1457454 |title=Malaysian Airlines Flight MH17: Netherlands Declares National Day of Mourning For MH17 Victims |work=International Business Times |date=20 July 2014 |accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref> The opening ceremony of the AIDS 2014 conference, on 20 July, of which several delegates had been on board Flight MH17, began with a tribute to the victims of the crash.<ref name="starobserver">{{cite news |url=http://www.starobserver.com.au/news/local-news/aids-2014-opening-ceremony-tinged-with-sombre-mood/125442 |title=AIDS 2014 opening ceremony tinged with sombre mood |first=Elias |last=Jahshan |work=Star Observer |date=20 July 2014 |accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref> In Malaysia, makeshift memorials were created in the capital city of [[Kuala Lumpur]].<ref name="bbc memorials">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-28397889 |title=MH17 crash: Malaysians mourn at makeshift memorials |publisher=BBC News |first=Sharanjit |last=Leyl |date=21 July 2014 |accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref>
==Russian media coverage== {{See also|Media portrayal of the Ukrainian crisis}} In July 2014, shortly after the crash, the liberal Russian opposition newspaper ''[[Novaya Gazeta]]'' published a headline in Dutch that read "Vergeef ons, Nederland" ("Forgive Us, Netherlands").<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/world/russian-newspaper-novaya-gazeta-prints-frontpage-apology-for-mh17-disaster-in-dutch/story-fndir2ev-1227001958997|title=Russian newspaper Novaya Gazeta prints front-page apology for MH17 disaster in Dutch|date=25 July 2014|accessdate=25 July 2014|publisher=News.com.au}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.foreignpolicy.com/posts/2014/07/25/russian_paper_issues_front_page_apology_to_netherlands_for_mh17|title=Russian Paper Issues Front Page Apology to Netherlands for MH17|last1=Groll|first1=Elias|date=25 July 2014|website=Foreign Policy|accessdate=25 July 2014}}</ref>
Coverage by official media and bodies has however differed from coverage in most other countries and significantly changed over time<ref>{{cite news |title=Russia offers alternate scenarios for Malaysia Airlines crash |url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2014/07/22/Russia-offers-alternate-scenarios-for-Malaysia-Airlines-crash/2701406045751/ |date=22 July 2014 |accessdate=2 November 2014 |first=Ed |last=Adamczyk |agency=United Press International |quote=Russian media offers explanations conflicting with the information provided by the rest of the world.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Ioffe |first1=Julia |title=The Russian Public Has a Totally Different Understanding of What Happened to Malaysia Airlines Flight 17: And it's more of a problem than you think |url=https://newrepublic.com/node/118782 |accessdate=21 July 2014 |work=New Republic |date=20 July 2014 |quote=The picture of the catastrophe that the Russian people are seeing on their television screens is very different from that on screens in much of the rest of the world, and the discrepancy does not bode well for a sane resolution to this stand-off |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140721015346/http://www.newrepublic.com/node/118782 |archive-date=21 July 2014 |dead-url=yes }}</ref> usually in response to new evidence published by DSB and the investigation team.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bellingcat.com/news/uk-and-europe/2018/01/05/kremlins-shifting-self-contradicting-narratives-mh17/|title=The Kremlin's Shifting, Self-Contradicting Narratives on MH17 - bellingcat|date=5 January 2018|work=bellingcat|access-date=5 January 2018|language=en-US}}</ref>
According to the poll conducted by the [[Levada Center]] between 18 and 24 July in 2014, 80% of Russians surveyed believed that the crash of MH17 was caused by the Ukrainian military. Only 3% of respondents to the poll blamed the disaster on pro-Russian separatists in eastern Ukraine.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.levada.ru/30-07-2014/katastrofa-boinga-pod-donetskom|title=Катастрофа "Боинга" под Донецком|date=30 July 2014|publisher=Levada.ru|accessdate=10 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jul/30/mh17-vast-majority-russians-believe-ukraine-downed-plane-poll|title=MH17: vast majority of Russians believe Ukraine downed plane, poll finds|last1=Luhn|first1=Alec|work=The Guardian|accessdate=2 August 2014|agency=Guardian News and Media Limited}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/more-than-80-of-russians-blame-ukrainian-army-for-malaysia-airlines-crash/504333.html|title=More Than 80% of Russians Blame Ukrainian Army for MH17 Crash|work=The Moscow Times|accessdate=8 September 2014}}</ref>
In December 2017 the Russian portal ''The Insider'', the news agency [[McClatchyDC]], and Bellingcat performed a joint investigation that confirmed the identity of a high-rank military officer using a call-sign "Dolphin" to be colonel general Nikolai Fedorovich Tkachev. Tkachev is frequently heard in the wiretaps acquired by JIT supervising the operation of "Buk" delivery and set-up.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bellingcat.com/news/uk-and-europe/2017/12/08/russian-colonel-general-delfin/|title=Russian Colonel General Identified as Key MH17 Figure – bellingcat|date=8 December 2017|work=bellingcat|access-date=8 December 2017|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>[http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/nation-world/world/article188720184.html]</ref>
=== Initial reactions and "An-26 downing" version === On the evening of the crash, the [[Life (news agency, Russia)|LifeNews]] portal released a statement from the separatists saying that a "Ukrainian Air Force [[An-26]] transport plane" had been shot down by a missile and crashed.<ref name="lifenews 136801">{{cite news|script-title=ru:Ополченцы сообщили о сбитом Ан-26 на востоке Украины |url=http://lifenews.ru/news/136801 |quote=On July 17 near the village of Rassypnoye over the Torez city in Donetsk region an An-26 transport plane of Ukrainian Air Force was taken down, said the militia. According to them, the plane crashed somewhere near the "Progress" mine, away from residential areas. According to one of the militias, at about 17:30 local time an An-26 flew over the city. It was hit by a rocket, there was an explosion and the plane went to the ground, leaving a black smoke. Debris fell from the sky |accessdate=17 July 2014 |date=17 July 2014 |language=Russian}}</ref> [[ITAR-TASS]] and [[RIA Novosti]] also reported that an An-26 had been shot down by the separatist militia near Torez at around 16:00 local time in what it described as "yet another victory of DPR self-defence".<ref name="itartasblamesrebels">{{cite news|title=Donetsk People's Republic militia downs another Ukraine's An-26 plane – eyewitnesses |url=http://en.itar-tass.com/world/741164 |accessdate=18 July 2014 |agency=[[Information Telegraph Agency of Russia]] |date=17 July 2014 |ref=TASS2 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6RA3m6ZDd?url=http://en.itar-tass.com/world/741164 |archivedate=18 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Транспортный Ан-26 сбит на востоке Украины, заявили очевидцы |url=http://ria.ru/world/20140717/1016409306.html |website=ria.ru |agency=RIA Novosti |date=17 July 2014 |accessdate=13 October 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6RR2Ynt9a?url=http://ria.ru/world/20140717/1016409306.html |archivedate=29 July 2014 |df= }}</ref> There was no evidence about altitude and weapons used.
Shortly after it became evident that the plane was a civilian one the separatist media denied any involvement in the crash and possession of anti-aircraft missiles capable of reaching this altitude.<ref name="vk.com">{{cite web |title=Сводки от Стрелкова Игоря Ивановича |url=http://vk.com/strelkov_info |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140717152222/http://vk.com/strelkov_info |archivedate=17 July 2014 |website=VKontakte |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref><ref name="Arthur Bright">{{cite web |url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Europe/2014/0717/Web-evidence-points-to-pro-Russia-rebels-in-downing-of-MH17-video |title=Web evidence points to pro-Russia rebels in downing of MH17 (+video) |author=Arthur Bright |date=17 July 2014 |website=[[The Christian Science Monitor]]}}</ref><ref name="auto1" />
=== Conspiracy theories === On 18 July Commander of the [[Donbass People's Militia]] [[Igor Strelkov (officer)|Igor Girkin]] was quoted as stating that "a significant number of the bodies weren't fresh". He followed up by saying "Ukrainian authorities are capable of any baseness"; and also claimed that blood serum and medications were found in the plane's wreckage in large quantities.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://news.yahoo.com/rebel-leader-gives-bizarre-account-plane-crash-182256709.html|title=Rebel leader gives bizarre account of plane crash|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140721032149/http://bigstory.ap.org/article/rebel-suggests-malaysia-plane-victims-long-dead|archivedate=21 July 2014|deadurl=yes|publisher=Yahoo! News|agency=Associated Press}}</ref> Girkin also claimed that some of the passengers had died a few days before the crash.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rusvesna.su/news/1405676334|author=Игорь Стрелков|date=18 July 2014|publisher=RusVesna|language=Russian|script-title=ru:Игорь Стрелков: часть людей из Боинга умерли за несколько суток до катастрофы|trans-title=Some of the Boeing's passengers died a few days before the crash|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6RBLozt4P?url=http://rusvesna.su/news/1405676334|archivedate=19 July 2014|deadurl=no|accessdate=19 July 2014|df=}}</ref>
The Russian government-funded<ref>{{cite news |last=Squires |first=Nick |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/10976920/British-journalist-working-for-Russian-TV-resigns-over-bias-in-Ukraine-MH17-coverage.html |title=British journalist working for Russian TV resigns over bias in Ukraine MH17 coverage |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=18 July 2014 |accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref> outlet [[RT (TV network)|RT]] initially said that the plane may have been shot down by Ukraine in a failed attempt to assassinate Vladimir Putin, in a plot which was organised by Ukraine's "Western backers". This was quickly dismissed as Putin's flight route was going hundreds of kilometres north of Ukraine.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://wyborcza.pl/1,75477,16347795,Moskwa_obwinia_Ukraine.html?piano_t=1 |title='Zamach na Putina', 'Ile odszkodowań zapłacą Ukraińcy' i zmiany w Wikipedii. Ofensywa propagandowa Moskwy |language=Polish|trans-title="The attempt on Putin", "How much compensation will pay Ukrainians" and changes in Wikipedia. Moscow's propaganda offensive |subscription=yes |work=Gazeta Wyborcza |date=18 July 2014 |accessdate=19 July 2014 |first=Wacław |last=Radziwinowicz}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.businessinsider.co.id/rt-malaysia-airlines-ukraine-2014-7/ |title=Here's The Ridiculous Way Russia's Propaganda Channel Is Covering The Malaysia Airlines Crash |last1=Szoldra |first1=Paul |publisher=Business Insider |date=18 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140720054152/http://www.businessinsider.co.id/rt-malaysia-airlines-ukraine-2014-7/ |archivedate=20 July 2014 }}</ref>
Other conspiracy theories propagated by Russian media included that the Ukrainians shot down the plane by mistake, drawing parallels to downing [[Siberia Airlines Flight 1812]] in 2001 (reported in July<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=c39_1406649680 |title=German media published a shock confessions of pilots Ukraine on Su-25 in day when MH17 got disaster |publisher=LiveLeak |date=29 July 2014 |accessdate=27 December 2014}}</ref> and in December 2014<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-30597555 |title=MH17: Russia reveals 'witness' who blames Ukraine pilot |publisher=BBC |date=24 December 2014 |accessdate=27 December 2014}}</ref>); that Ukrainian air traffic controllers purposefully redirected the flight to fly over the war zone (proven false by the DSB investigation); and that the Ukrainian government organised the attack on the plane to bring infamy upon the pro-Russian rebels.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://news.yahoo.com/russians-fed-conspiracy-theories-ukraine-crash-064400429.html |title=Russians Fed Conspiracy Theories on Ukraine Crash |work=Yahoo News |date=22 July 2014 |accessdate=22 July 2014 |first=Laura |last=Mills |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref>
The number of alternative theories disseminated in Russian mass media started growing as the DSB and JIT investivations increasingly pointed towards the separatists.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://buran.ru/htm/mh17.htm|title=Как и почему погиб рейс МН17 над Донбассом? Брифинг Министерства обороны России|website=buran.ru|access-date=6 August 2016}}</ref> On 15 November 2014, Russia's [[Channel One Russia|Channel One]] reported on a supposedly leaked spy satellite photo which showed the plane being shot from behind by a Ukrainian Su-25 fighter jet.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.1tv.ru/news/social/271864 |title=Снимок малайзийского "Боинга", сбитого под Донецком, обсуждают во всем мире |date=15 November 2014 |website=Channel One Russia}}</ref><ref>{{citation |title=Russia's Channel One show satellite photo evidencing MH17 was downed by fighter jet |work=TASS |date=14 November 2014 |accessdate=15 November 2014 |url=http://en.itar-tass.com/world/759835}}</ref> Many other Russian media reprinted the photo but its authenticity was immediately dismissed as the airplanes were out of scale which indicated poor copy-and-paste.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.theage.com.au/world/sensational-russian-photo-of-mh17-being-shot-debunked-by-citizen-journalist-group-20141115-11nbqs.html |title='Sensational' Russian photo of MH17 being shot debunked by citizen journalist group |last=Miller |first=Nick |date=15 November 2014 |accessdate=15 November 2014 |newspaper=The Age}}</ref> Later it was disclosed, that the photo had been initially emailed to the Vice-President of the [[Russian Union of Engineers]] by a self-described aviation expert who had found it on a Russian online forum.<ref name="BUZZnov2014">{{citation |title=Russian TV Airs Clearly Fake Image To Claim Ukraine Shot Down MH17 |first=Max |last=Seddon |date=15 November 2014 |accessdate=15 October 2014 |work=BuzzFeed |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/maxseddon/russian-tv-airs-clearly-fake-image-to-claim-ukraine-shot-dow}}</ref> The aviation expert later apologised, saying that he was unhappy with how the information had been used.<ref name="BUZZnov2014" />
In July 2014, Sara Firth, who had worked as a correspondent with RT for the previous five years, resigned in protest at the channel's coverage of the crash, which she described as "lies".<ref name="sarafirth">{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/travel/travel-updates/mh17-fallout-russian-reporter-sara-firth-quits-over-ukraine-lies/story-fnizu68q-1226994372531|title=MH17 fallout: Russian reporter Sara Firth quits over Ukraine 'lies'|date=28 March 2014|publisher=News.com.au|accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref> RT said Firth had left to take another job.<ref name="ReporterResigns">{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2014/jul/18/mh17-russia-today-reporter-resigns-sara-firth-kremlin-malaysia|title=Russia Today reporter resigns in protest at MH17 coverage|work=The Guardian|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
In 2017 Dutch newspaper ''[[NRC Handelsblad]]'' described how false stories about the MH17 crash had been propagated with the support of [[Christian Democratic Appeal]] politician [[Pieter Omtzigt]], who introduced a Russian-speaking Ukrainian man as an "eyewitness" to the crash on a public expert debate in May 2017. The man, who was an asylum-seeker from Ukraine, did not witness the crash and his speech, texted to him by Omtzigt prior to the interview, repeated the Russian-promoted version that Ukrainian jets downed the Boeing.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2017/11/10/hoe-twijfel-rond-mh17-in-de-hand-wordt-gewerkt-13959091-a1580806|title=Hoe twijfel rond MH17 in de hand wordt gewerkt|work=NRC|access-date=13 November 2017|language=nl}}</ref>
=== The "Ukrainian Buk" version === In May 2015 ''Novaya Gazeta'' published a report by "a group of Russian military engineers" that came to the conclusion that the airplane was shot down by a [[Buk missile system|Buk-M1 launcher]] with 9M38M1 missile. The authors also analysed the visible impact traces on the surface of the airplane and suggested that the missile couldn't have been fired from [[Snizhne]], but was instead fired from [[Zaroshchenske]] and claimed that a Ukrainian anti-air unit was located there at that time.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.novayagazeta.ru/inquests/68332.html |title=Это был "Бук-М1" |publisher=Novaya Gazeta |date=5 May 2015 |accessdate=5 May 2015 |trans-title=This was "Buk-M1"}}</ref> In June 2015 the report was the subject of a press conference and was attributed to Mikhail Malisevskiy, chief engineer at Moscow-headquartered [[Almaz-Antey]], the Buk missile manufacturer.<ref name="TheAgeAlmaz">{{cite news |url=http://www.theage.com.au/world/mh17-plane-was-shot-down-by-a-buk-missile-russian-weapons-manufacturer-says-20150602-ghfdco.html |title=MH17 plane was shot down by a Buk missile, Russian weapons manufacturer says |author=Nick Miller |date=2 June 2015}}</ref> The [[Security Service of Ukraine]] said that there were inaccuracies in this version, and called part of the report a fake.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.stopfake.org/sbu-novye-dokazatelstva-krusheniya-boeing-na-donbasse-osnovany-na-fejkovyh-snimkah/ |title=СБУ: Новые "доказательства" крушения Boeing на Донбассе основаны на фейковых снимках |date=6 May 2015 |accessdate=6 May 2015 |website= |publisher=StopFake.org|trans-title = SBU called the Russian analysis on Boeing based on fake photos}}</ref> Russian military expert Vadim Lukashevich argued on [[TV Rain]] that the spatial orientation of the rocket at the moment of explosion did not exclude the possibility that it was launched from Snizhne, as the report claimed. Lukashevich also noted that the report admitted a Buk missile as the cause of the crash, discrediting the previous theories about the crash (Su-25 etc.) circulated in Russian media.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://m.tvrain.ru/teleshow/here_and_now/ja_ne_uvidel_v_etom_doklade_ekspertov_vpk_aviatsio-386961/ |title=Я не увидел в этом докладе экспертов ВПК". Авиационный эксперт Лукашевич о том, кто и зачем готовил документ, раздобытый "Новой газетой |date=6 May 2015 |accessdate=6 May 2015 |website= |publisher=TV Rain |last=Lukashevich |first=Vadim|trans-title = "I haven't seen military experts in that report", aviation expert Lukashevich who and why published the report leaked by Novaya Gazeta}}</ref> ''[[Ukrainska Pravda]]'' questioned claims about the Ukrainian anti-aircraft unit and stated that Zaroshchenske was under control of pro-Russian forces on the day of shootdown.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2015/05/6/7066943/ |title=ЗМІ: Російські експерти в секретній доповіді підтвердили, що Боїнг збили з "Бука" |date=6 May 2015 |accessdate=6 May 2015 |website= |publisher=Ukrainska Pravda|trans-title = Media: Russian experts confirmed in secret report, that Boeing was shot by "Buk"}}</ref> ''Novaya Gazeta'' published a long analysis by Mark Solonin, also denying the Almaz-Antey version,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.novayagazeta.ru/inquests/68376.html |title=Сверим траектории |date=12 May 2015 |website=Novaya Gazeta |last=Solonin |first=Mark}}</ref> interviewed inhabitants of Zaroshchenske who denied claims that Ukrainian forces and Buk launchers were present in the village at that time.<ref>{{cite web |title=There Was No Buk in Our Field |url=http://www.interpretermag.com/there-was-no-buk-in-our-field/ |website=The Interpreter |accessdate=11 June 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=На нашем поле "Бука" не было. Ни следа – ни от гусениц, ни от велосипеда |url=http://www.novayagazeta.ru/inquests/68728.html |accessdate=8 June 2015}}</ref> According to [[Bellingcat]], Russia's satellite images were from June and showed signs of editing.<ref name="Bell150531">{{cite news |url=https://www.bellingcat.com/news/uk-and-europe/2015/05/31/mh17-forensic-analysis-of-satellite-images-released-by-the-russian-ministry-of-defence/ |title=MH17 – Forensic Analysis of Satellite Images Released by the Russian Ministry of Defence |work=Bellingcat |date=31 May 2015}}</ref><ref name="DW150601">{{cite news |url=http://www.dw.de/forensic-report-russia-faked-mh17-satellite-photos/a-18490259 |title=Forensic report: Russia faked MH17 satellite photos |first=Conor |last=Dillon |publisher=[[Deutsche Welle]] |date=1 June 2015}}</ref> ''[[Bild]]'' described the Russian satellite image as "fake".<ref name="Bild150508">{{cite news |url=http://www.bild.de/politik/ausland/flug-mh-17/russische-beweise-gefaelscht-40861842.bild.html |title=BILD entlarvt falsche Satellitenaufnahme |language=German |trans-title= BILD exposes false satellite image |first=Julian |last=Röpcke |work=[[Bild]] |date=8 May 2015}}</ref>
On 17 September 2018, Russia's Ministry of Defense held a press conference that aimed to cast doubt on Moscow's culpability for the tragedy. Lt. Gen. Nikolai Parshin, chief of the Missile and Artillery Directorate, told that after Dutch investigators displayed parts of the missile and their serial numbers, they studied and declassified archives at the research center that produced the Buk missiles. Parshin said the Russian archives show that the missile that was made of these parts was transported to a military unit in western Ukraine in 1986, and to Russia's knowledge never left Ukraine. Officials also claim that video evidence presented by Joint Investigation Team (JIT), in which the missile that allegedly shot down the plane being moved from Russia into Ukraine, were fabricated.<ref>{{cite news |url= https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2018/09/17/world/europe/ap-eu-russia-mh17.html |title= Russia: Missile That Shot Down Flight MH17 Was Ukrainian |date= 17 September 2018 |work= The New York Times}}</ref>
JIT responded that it had requested Russia in May 2018 on the issue of details about recovered missile parts, but had received no answer. Information from the Russian Ministry of Defense will be carefully studied as soon as the documents were made available, as requested in May 2018 and required by [[United Nations Security Council|UNSC]] in 2016. JIT stated it had always carefully analysed information provided by Russia, but information presented to the public was inaccurate on several points. Russia has given differing accounts over time of how MH17 was shot down; for example they also claimed to have evidence (radar image) of Ukrainian fighter fired an air-to-air missile to MH17.<ref>{{cite news |title=MH17 crash: Dutch ask Russia to submit new claims |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-45546611 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |publisher=BBC News |date=18 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Parket |first1=Landelijk |title=Reaction JIT to press conference of Russian Ministry of Defense |url=https://www.om.nl/actueel/nieuwsberichten/@104053/reaction-jit-to/ |website=Openbaar Ministerie |accessdate=18 September 2018}}</ref>
[[Oleksandr Turchynov]], secretary of [[National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine]], said that Russia's claim is "yet another failed fake report that the Kremlin made up in order to cover up their crime that has been proven by the official investigation as well as independent experts."<ref>{{cite news |url= https://www.newsweek.com/russian-propaganda-moscow-releases-audio-blaming-ukraine-downing-mh17-flight-1124371 |title= Russian propaganda? Moscow releases audio blaming Ukraine downing MH17 flight that killed almost 300 |date= 17 September 2018 |work= Newsweek}}</ref>

{{Infobox song contest | name = Melodifestivalen | year = 2018 | semi1 = 3 February 2018 | semi2 = 10 February 2018 | semi3 = 17 February 2018 | semi4 = 24 February 2018 | second = 3 March 2018 | final = 10 March 2018 | presenters = David Lindgren
Fab Freddie | winner = "[[Dance You Off]]" by [[Benjamin Ingrosso]] | host = [[Sveriges Television|SVT]] | venue = | entries = 28 }} '''Melodifestivalen 2018''' was the 58th edition of the Swedish music competition [[Melodifestivalen]], which selected Sweden's entry for the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2018]]. The competition was organised by [[Sveriges Television]] (SVT) and took place over a six-week period between 3 February and 10 March 2018. The format of the competition consists of 6 shows: 4 semi-final rounds, a second chance round and a final. An initial 28 entries were selected for the competition through three methods: an open call for song submissions, direct invitations to specific artists and songwriters and a wildcard given to one of the artists that participated in the ''Svensktoppen nästa'' competition organised by [[Sveriges Radio P4]]. The 28 competing entries were divided into four semi-finals, with seven compositions in each. From each semi-final, the songs that earn first and second place qualify directly to the final, while the songs that place third and fourth proceed to the Second Chance round. The bottom three songs in each semi-final will be eliminated from the competition. An additional four entries qualify from the Second Chance round to the final, bringing the total number of competing entries in the final to 12. All 6 shows were hosted by [[David Lindgren]] and [[Fredrik Svensson (presenter)|Fredrik Svensson]], known as Fab Freddie. The winner of the competition is [[Benjamin Ingrosso]] with the song "[[Dance You Off]]." He represented Sweden at the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2018]] which was held in [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]], where he came seventh with 274 points. == Format == Melodifestivalen 2018, organised by [[Sveriges Television]] (SVT), was be the seventeenth consecutive edition of the contest in which the competition took place in different cities across Sweden.{{cite web |date=16 June 2017|url=http://www.svtstatic.se/image-cms/svtse/1498570016/melodifestivalen/article14262752.svt/BINARY/Melodifestivalen%20rules%202018.pdf|title=Invitation to the 2018 Melodifestival |website=svt.se |publisher=[[Sveriges Television]] |accessdate=16 June 2017}} The four semi-finals were held at the [[Löfbergs Arena]] in [[Karlstad]] (3 February), the [[Scandinavium]] in [[Gothenburg]] (10 February), the [[Malmö Arena]] in [[Malmö]] (17 February) and the [[Fjällräven Center]] in [[Örnsköldsvik]] (24 February).{{Cite news|url=https://www.escxtra.com/2017/09/26/dates-melodifestivalen-2018-confirmed/|title=Dates for Melodifestivalen 2018 Confirmed - ESCXTRA.com|date=2017-09-26|work=ESCXTRA|access-date=2017-11-10|last=Jumawan|first=Timothy John}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.svt.se/melodifestivalen/hit-kommer-melodifestivalen-2018|title=Hit kommer Melodifestivalen 2018|last=Sweden|first=Sveriges Television AB, Stockholm,|work=svt.se|access-date=2017-11-10|language=sv}} The Second Chance round took place at the [[Kristianstad Arena]] in [[Kristianstad]] on 3 March while the final was held at the [[Friends Arena]] in [[Stockholm]] on 10 March. An initial 28 entries competed in the semi-finals, with seven entries taking part in each show. The top two entries from each semi-final advanced directly to the final, while the third and fourth placed entries advanced to the Second Chance round. The bottom three entries in each semi-final were eliminated. An additional four entries qualified for the final from the Second Chance round, bringing the total number of competing entries in the final to 12. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! colspan="4"| Competition Schedule |- ! [[Image:MaternityclinicNafovanny.jpg|right|thumb|250px|Nafovanny's maternity clinic. Photographed undercover by the [[British Union for the Abolition of Vivisection|BUAV]].<ref name=video>[http://video.aol.com/video-detail/monkey-business-a-buav-undercover-investigation/3430297686 "Conditions at Nafovanny"], video produced by the [[British Union for the Abolition of Vivisection]] following an undercover investigation.</ref> (video)]]
'''Nafovanny''' in [[Vietnam]] is the largest captive-breeding primate facility in the world, supplying [[Crab-eating Macaque|long-tailed macaque]]s (''Macaca fascicularis'') to [[animal testing]] laboratories, including [[Huntingdon Life Sciences]] in the [[United Kingdom|UK]] and [[Covance]] in [[Germany]].<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20070218140802/http://www.buav.org/campaigns/primates/monkeybusiness/about.htm "About Nafovanny"], [[British Union for the Abolition of Vivisection]]; see also [https://web.archive.org/web/20070218140902/http://www.buav.org/campaigns/primates/monkeybusiness/introduction.htm "Introduction"]; [https://web.archive.org/web/20070218140812/http://www.buav.org/campaigns/primates/monkeybusiness/conditions.htm "Conditions"]; [https://web.archive.org/web/20070218140921/http://www.buav.org/campaigns/primates/monkeybusiness/wild.htm "Wild Capture"], BUAV.</ref>
==Background== Nafovanny was set up in 1994 by Vanny Chian Technology, a [[Hong Kong]] company, according to [[Reuters]].<ref>[http://coombs.anu.edu.au/~vern/wild-trade/docs/vanny-scmp.txt Vietnam: Hong Kong Firm Starts Vietnam Monkey Business], Reuters, December 5, 1994, link courtesy of the Australian National University, accessed February 26, 2008.</ref> The company is reported to have set up a [[United States dollar|U.S.]]$2 million joint venture company, called Nafovanny, with Vietnam's Forestry Ministry, with the intention of creating a network of monkey farms in southern Vietnam.
Responding to criticism of the project from Dr. John Wedderburn, a former member of the [[RSPCA]]'s ruling council, Daniel Chen, a director of Vanny Chain Technology, said: "We have not got a problem with that because what we are doing is very humane and it is for the welfare of human beings."<ref>Wallis, Keith. [http://coombs.anu.edu.au/~vern/wild-trade/docs/vanny-scmp.txt Vietnam: Anger at Monkey Farm Plan], ''South China Morning Post'', December 6, 2004, link courtesy of the Australian National University, accessed February 26, 2008.</ref>
==Location and size== Nafovanny consists of two main farms in Long Thanh<ref name=HansardJan222007>[https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm200607/cmhansrd/cm070122/text/70122w0019.htm "Animals: Scientific Procedures Inspectorate"], ''Hansard'', January 22, 2007, Column 1529W.</ref> near the [[Cambodia]]n border, with a total area of 90,000 square meters, able to hold 30,000 monkeys. According to the [[British Union for the Abolition of Vivisection]] (BUAV), the facility also maintains satellite breeding farms on the Cambodian border, in which the BUAV alleges wild monkeys may also be held; the existence of these farms is not referenced in the company's brochure, according to the BUAV.<ref name=about>[https://web.archive.org/web/20070218140802/http://www.buav.org/campaigns/primates/monkeybusiness/about.htm "About Nafovanny"], British Union for the Abolition of Vivisection.</ref>
The [[Home Office|British Home Office]] has said it has no knowledge of Nafovanny satellite farms. However, it also said that "This decision was premised upon the contractual arrangements having been entered into in good-faith whilst Nafovanny was still considered to be an acceptable source, and animals already selected for onward supply to the UK. The view was taken that proper provision would be made for the welfare of these animals prior to their being shipped to the UK – and that this could be verified from the records and findings on arrival." <ref>[http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/about-us/freedom-of-information/released-information/foi-archive-research1/4999-non-human-primates-overseas?view=Html "Questions on the acquisition and supply of non-human primates from overseas sources (Nafovanny)"], Home Office, February 14, 2007.</ref>
==Customers== The British government approved Nafovanny to export [[primate]]s to British laboratories in 1999.<ref name=about/> The British [[Animal Procedures Committee|Animal Scientific Procedures Inspectorate]] visited Nafovanny in March 2005, and identified "shortcomings in animal accommodation and care," but since then the government has "received assurances and evidence that significant improvements have been made."<ref name=HansardNov232006>[http://www.parliament.the-stationery-office.co.uk/pa/cm200607/cmhansrd/cm061123/text/61123w0016.htm "Primates"], ''Hansard'', November 23, 2006, Column 231W.</ref>
According to ''Viet Nam News'', 3,000 Nafovanny macaques were exported to the [[United States|U.S.]] for testing purposes in 2000.<ref name=Tran>Tran Dinh Thanh Lam. [http://vietnamnews.vnanet.vn/2004-06/26/Columns/Kaleidoscope.htm "Kaleidoscope"], ''Viet Nam News'', June 28, 2004.</ref>
==See also== *[[Animal testing on non-human primates]] *[[International trade in primates]]
==Notes== {{reflist}}
==Further reading== *[https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/ld199697/ldhansrd/pdvn/lds06/text/60725w0258.htm#column_WA241 "Animal Research: Primates], ''Hansard'', July 25, 2006.
{{atestingend}} {{Animal rights|state=collapsed}}
